Linux users can convert one of these 'VP7' files to a VLC-playable AVI file with this one-liner:
mencoder somesourcevideo.avi -oac copy -ovc xvid -xvidencopts pass=1 -o /dev/null && mencoder somesourcevideo.avi -oac copy -ovc xvid -xvidencopts pass=2:bitrate=950 -o destinationvideo.avi

Change 'somesourcevideo.avi' and 'destinationvideo.avi' to the input and output files respectively.  Requires 'mencoder' to be installed.  For batch processing, see the script on this page:
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=502179

A solution for VP7 codec on a Mac. I have used this and know that this works.

Just download the MPlayerOSX 1.0rc2 (thats the version i used) from here :
http://www.mplayerhq.hu/MPlayer/releases/MPlayerOSX_1.0rc2.dmg

and the essential codecs for mac package from here : 

http://www.mplayerhq.hu/MPlayer/releases/codecs/essential-macosx-x86-20060611.zip

Install both of them and then play vp7 encoded video with MPlayer OSX. Works Flawlessly!

(thanks to scott for the fix ;).. )
I also checked on the latest version of MPlayer OSX that wass some version 8b4. Did NOT work on that. Only Version 1.0rc2 :)
